resources.string: Reminder set %1$s hour%2$s before the notification
Reminder set %s minutes before the notification
Remind me when the priority changes
Alarm set on due date at
You are scheduled to have \"%1$s\" now.\n\nLocation: %2$s.

You are scheduled for the task \"%1$s\" in %2$sh : %3$sm.\n\nLocation: %4$s
You are scheduled for the task \"%1$s\" in %2$d minutes.\n\nLocation: %3$s
You are scheduled to have \"%1$s\" in %2$s hour%3$s.\n\nLocation: %4$s
Warning :\nThis task priority has chance to: %s.
This task is due today at %s. You should prepare any necessities needed to complete this task.
The \"End time\" must be greater than the \"Start time\".
This event must not overlap with other event.
The wake-up call time must be set before the due time.
The wake-up call time have already passed.
Always set on when creating a new task or a timetable event.
Always set at 5 minutes before the notification.
Always remind me when the priority changes.
No settings applied. Click here to modify.
Set at %s (24h format). Click here to modify.
You can\'t delete the current week.
Weeks must not have the same position nor the same title.

If you are in Timetable or in Task (main section), touch the left side of the screen then swipe right to navigate between menus. If you are in Settings, About or Tutorial (sub section), press the back button to navigate to the main section. \n\nNote: To see this tutorial again, navigate to the About, scroll down and click on TUTORIAL.

In Task, swipe left or right to navigate between ONGOING and COMPLETED section. 

Add a task: 
- Click on the “+” sign button 
- Fill in the information 
- Click save 

Complete a task: 
In ONGOING section, click on the check box (square box below the alarm icon) of the task you wish to set as completed. By doing so, your task will be removed from ONGOING and placed in COMPLETED section. 

Delete a task: 
- Click on the “x” sign icon

In Timetable, swipe left or right to navigate between days. 

Add an event: 
- Click on the “+” sign button 
- Fill in the information 
- Click save 

View other week: 
- Click on the menu (three dots on the top right corner) 
- Click on Week Preview 
- Click on the week you wish to view 
- Click on the back button to exit the preview 

Delete an event: 
- Click on the “x” sign icon

Navigate to Settings and click on Week. 

Add a week: 
- Click on the “+” sign button 
- Fill in the week name 
- Click OK 

Update a week: 
- Click on the week you wish to update 
- Change the name if needed 
- Set it as current week if needed 
- Click OK 

Change the order 
- Press the week you wish to change the position until it turns grey 
- Drag up or down to change its position 

Delete a week: 
Swipe left or right to delete a week.

Schedule is a notification based app that helps you manage your time. The main features of the app include a timetable and a task manager. 

Timetable manager: 
- Timetable any number of weeks to rotate through. 
- Get a notification at the start or the end of each event. 
- Set a custom reminder before each notification. 

Task manager: 
- Create a detailed task with a deadline. 
- Get a notification at the start of each task. 
- Colour-coded reminders as the deadline gets closer. 
- Set Wake up call: a reminder on the morning of your deadline to make sure you have everything needed in order to complete the task.
Designed and built by Aston Tanion.

Launcher icon : made by Aston Tanion 
Timetable icon : made by Freepik from www.flaticon.com 
Task icon : made by Freepik from www.flaticon.com 
Settings icon : made by Freepik from www.flaticon.com 
Help icon : made by Freepik from www.flaticon.com 
About icon : made by Freepik from www.flaticon.com
